result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin L Schroeder

records.addlTxt:
2:09 PM Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court for Justin L Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. Atty Kuhary states the blood test results are not in yet and requests to adjourn for further proceedings in about 45-60 days. Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.

2:19 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary appeared by Zoom video for Justin L Schroeder.   Attorney appears by authorization.   Atty. Kuhary provides an update, he has discovery but is waiting on the blood test results.  Atty. Kuhary is requesting another further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by Atty. Kuhary requesting permission to appear by Zoom for the 9/1/2022 Hearing.   **Reviewed by Judge Melvin, on behalf of Branch 7, 8/31/22 - Request granted.**
Authorization for Appearance;  filed by Atty. Craig Kuhary

ADDRESS INFO for Justin L Schroeder
Current: 219 W 3rd St, Oconomowoc, WI 53066 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)
Prior: 219 W 3Rd St, Oconomowoc, WI 53066

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

1:53 PM Defendant Justin L Schroeder in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Justin L Schroeder. Attorney appears as friend of the court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
